Brodmann.8.name: Brodmann.8
Brodmann.8.description: Brodmann.8 is a region located in the frontal lobe of the brain, specifically in the precentral gyrus. It is responsible for controlling eye movements and visual attention.
Brodmann.8.related corpus: Brodmann.8 is closely related to other regions in the frontal lobe, such as the prefrontal cortex and the supplementary eye field. It also has connections to the parietal lobe and the superior colliculus. Damage to Brodmann.8 can result in deficits in eye movements and visual attention, such as in patients with frontal eye field syndrome. It has also been implicated in disorders such as schizophrenia and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Brodmann.8 plays a role in visual attention and the ability to shift attention between different stimuli. It is also involved in working memory and decision-making processes. There is limited research on the role of Brodmann.8 in emotions, but it may be involved in regulating emotional responses through its connections to the prefrontal cortex. Brodmann.8 is involved in controlling eye movements and visual attention, which are important for a wide range of behaviors such as reading, driving, and sports. It may also play a role in decision-making and impulse control. There is limited research on the effects of drugs on Brodmann.8 specifically, but drugs that affect dopamine and norepinephrine levels in the brain may impact its function.

Brodmann.6.name: Brodmann.6
Brodmann.6.description: Brodmann.6 is a region of the frontal lobe of the brain that is located in the precentral gyrus. It is involved in the planning and execution of voluntary movements.
Brodmann.6.related corpus: Brodmann.6 is closely associated with other regions of the motor cortex, including Brodmann.4 and Brodmann.8. It also has connections to the parietal lobe, which is involved in sensory processing and spatial awareness. Damage to Brodmann.6 can result in motor deficits, such as paralysis or weakness. It is also implicated in movement disorders such as Parkinson's disease and Huntington's disease. Brodmann.6 is primarily involved in motor planning and execution, but it may also play a role in higher cognitive functions such as decision-making and working memory.  Brodmann.6 is involved in the control of voluntary movements, including fine motor skills and complex movements such as speech and writing. There are no drugs specifically targeted at Brodmann.6, but medications used to treat movement disorders may affect this region indirectly.

Brodmann.4.name: Brodmann.4

Brodmann.4 is not directly involved in emotional processing, but it may indirectly influence emotional responses through its connections to other brain regions. There are no drugs specifically targeting Brodmann.4, but medications used to treat movement disorders may indirectly affect its function.
